body.p: Application Lifecycle Service supports deploying Clojure applications using leiningen.
To create a new Clojure web application, install leiningen and Noir (a Clojure web framework):
body.codeblock: lein noir new myapp ... cd myapp/
body.p: Now deploy to Application Lifecycle Service. Accept the defaults for each prompt:
body.codeblock: helion push myapp [...] Application Deployed URL: 'myapp.helion-xxxx.local'? [...] Starting Application: OK
body.p: Open the application's URL in your browser to see the default Noir welcome page.

section.title: Clojure Database Services Example
section.codeblock: (defn assoc-cloud-env "Import Cloud Foundry / Application Lifecycle Service environment settings" [config] (let [port (Integer/parseInt (System/getenv "PORT")) srv (parse-string (System/getenv "VCAP_SERVICES")) cred ((first (srv "mongodb-1.8")) "credentials")] (assoc config :jetty-port port :db-host (cred "host") :db-port (cred "port") :db-user (cred "username") :db-pwd (cred "password") :db-dbname (cred "db"))))
